brewery.brewery_description:
We are an award-winning, independent brewery operating since 1992. We are run by a family of craft beer fanatics; our aim is to create the most delicious, flavoursome beers possible.

In 2019 we opened our taproom, The Brewhouse Project at Arundel, where you can try our beers as fresh as they come.

beer.beer_name: Never Tell Me the Odds Rum Barrel Aged

beer.beer_description: Rich smooth ale with a deep malty taste, subtle aromatic fruits and a bitter/sweet coffee finish.

A traditional English India Pale Ale with complex roasted malt flavours, leading to a fruity hoppy bittersweet finish.

Hops: Magnum, Goldings and Cascade

items.checkin_comment: Nice dark ale. Roasted malts, fruits with a nice bitter finish.

beer.beer_description: Rich smooth ale with a deep malty taste, subtle aromatic fruits and a bitter/sweet coffee finish.

items.badge_description: There's beer in them thar hills! You're setting off on your journey through the world of beer, but be sure to take a little time to get to know each brewery as you go. That's a beer from 390 different breweries. Try 5 more for Level 79!

beer.beer_description: Juicy and fruity pale ale. Brewed for the coming cost of living crisis, and trying to keep the cost of purchase for venues and customers to a minimum. We aim to try and have this beer available all winter long, because who else is going to help us all out?

user.bio: Admitted geek girl. Science & animal lover. Craft beer enthusiast. Shoe hater.

beer.beer_description: House beer of the Pond pub in Brighton

items.badge_description: Traveling the world is hard, but not for you. It's as easy as cracking open a new brew! You have had a beer from at least 25 different regions around the world. Try 5 more for Level 6!

beer.beer_description:
A traditional English India Pale Ale with complex roasted malt flavours, leading to a fruity hoppy bittersweet finish.

Hops: Magnum, Goldings and Cascade

A traditional English India Pale Ale with complex roasted malt flavours, leading to a fruity hoppy bittersweet finish.

Hops: Magnum, Goldings and Cascade

items.badge_description: Its been a long week and you deserve a drink, or five. Besides, isnt that what your check is for?
99 bottles of beer on the wall, 99 bottles of beer. Take one down, pass it around.... That's 405 checkins with the serving style of Bottle. Try 5 more for Level 82!

beer.beer_description: Our House, Our Rules.  Theres always time for an ice cold lager, unfiltered crisp and super smash'able.  We've brewed this one to German standards with all Germanic igredients.  For a crispy drop for all

user.bio: Once more BEER will rule the Galaxy, and we shall have Peace... - Emperor Palpatine

beer.beer_name: Never Tell Me the Odds Rum Barrel Aged
beer.beer_description:
10.5% Barrel Aged Imperial Stout, brewed in collaboration with both Emperors and Sussex Small Batch. A collaboration that's been hibernating in barrels since Spring 2022.
We first brewed this impy stout for 'Brewfest 2022', we then held half of it back and its been ageing in barrels ever since. Months and months in the making. Coming in at a whopping 11%, this stout is packed with flavour. Rich, smooth, brown sugar, cacao nibs and a comforting unami taste.

items.badge_name: Beyond a Shadow of a Stout (Level 84)
items.badge_description: We all love Stouts, and now we have a dedicated badge to celebrate your dedication to these dark, top-fermented beer in multiple variations, like Oatmeal, Milk and more! Which one will you start with? That's 420 different beers with the style of Stout. Try 5 more for Level 85!

beer.beer_description: Nice easy drinking table beer with Mosaic & Simcoe, brewed to support Arundel Lido
Blackberry & Plum Sour
Crispy pale ale made with super pale & lager malt and then dry hopped with Falconers Flight, Cascade & El Dorado hops.

Juicy and fruity pale ale. Brewed for the coming cost of living crisis, and trying to keep the cost of purchase for venues and customers to a minimum. We aim to try and have this beer available all winter long, because who else is going to help us all out?

items.badge_description: Want to enjoy a day of brews, but need to keep your wits sharp? There are plenty of delicious brews under 5% for you to sip on throughout the day. That's 115 different beers with an ABV of 5% and lower. Try 5 more for Level 24!

Canning is all the rage and it's not hard to see why - travels well, more environmentally friendly, and no need to carry your bottle opener. That's 5 checkins with the serving style of Can. Try 5 more for Level 2! Want to learn more about this badge? Check out our podcast

While a pint of traditional English ale will always remain a staple, the craft beer scene in England, much like the rest of the world, has continued to grow at a rapid rate! That's 65 different beers from a brewery from England! Try 5 more for Level 14!

beer.beer_description: Nice easy drinking table beer with Mosaic & Simcoe, brewed to support Arundel Lido

items.badge_description: Round and round the wheel goes! Which style youll be drinking, nobody knows! Your desire to explore different styles is inspiring. Keep it up! That's a check-in to at least 40 different styles. Try 5 more for Level 9!
Had enough tea and biscuits? Head to the pub for a pint! That's at least 125 beers from the UK. Try 5 more for Level 26.

beer.beer_description: Juicy and fruity pale ale. Brewed for the coming cost of living crisis, and trying to keep the cost of purchase for venues and customers to a minimum. We aim to try and have this beer available all winter long, because who else is going to help us all out?
A rich golden beer with a hoppy, citrus finish, very smooth, light and refreshing.

A traditional English India Pale Ale with complex roasted malt flavours, leading to a fruity hoppy bittersweet finish.

Hops: Magnum, Goldings and Cascade
A deliciously fruity New England IPA using London Ale Yeast 3 to produce a naturally hazy, flavourful hop bomb with minimal bitterness
For our 30th anniversary we have returned to the original recipe for Wild Heaven so expect a bit more malty overtones combined with the fruitless from the added orange zest

Inspired by a recent visit to Tree House in the US where we tried their Moments of Clarity stout which is an incredible beer. We've used cocoa nibs from Noble & Stace and freshly roasted coffee from Edgecumbe's.
A smooth tasting, lightly hopped dark ale with chocolate and roast aromas. Low hop addition gives a slightly sweeter character.

beer.beer_style: IPA - Imperial / Double New England / Hazy
beer.beer_description: This DIPA has been brewed to celebrate the opening of the Brewhouse Project. A new taproom & coffeehouse on the outskirts of Arundel. During the many months of working on the site, we saw countless dragonflies dipping and diving and hence the name
A tawny coloured beer with a hoppy aroma. The flavour has a good balance of malt, fruit and hops with a dry hoppy finish.
Rich smooth ale with a deep malty taste, subtle aromatic fruits and a bitter/sweet coffee finish.
Red Handed is a well rounded balanced red ale with tropical and citrusy notes from New Zealand and American hops which complements the caramel and toffee flavours from the malts
Dark old ale. Chocolate malt, Goldings Hops. Warm, soft, malty flavour.
A very smooth, full-flavoured premium bitter. An excellent balance of malt, fruit and hops comes through in this rich, chestnut-coloured beer.
A tawny brown beer, fruity aroma, lots of malt and fruit flavours and hoppy bitterness to finish.
House beer of the Pond pub in Brighton
Dark ale with a warm, soft, malty initial flavour. Chocolate malt adds a powerful high roast finish complimented by the pleasing aroma from Goldings hops.
An amber coloured beer with a citrus, fruity aroma. Has a hoppy, fruity flavour and a pleasant dry bitter finish.

Juicy and fruity pale ale. Brewed for the coming cost of living crisis, and trying to keep the cost of purchase for venues and customers to a minimum. We aim to try and have this beer available all winter long, because who else is going to help us all out?
Easy drinking with very low bitterness
The final version of our Clockwork series, using Mosaic & Idaho 7 to create a super sessionable & fruity hazy pale ale
A delicious lip puckering apricot & pear sour IPA brewed in collaboration with our friends at Unity Brewing Co
Our new Tarrant Street Table Beer is a smooth easy drinking 3.4% pale ale with lots of hoppy juiciness but relatively low bitterness

beer.beer_style: IPA - Imperial / Double New England / Hazy
beer.beer_description: Brewed in collaboration with Merakai and inspired by Green Is Good back in 2020, this monster of a beer combines a creamy mouthfeel from a 50% oats crisp with Mosaic, Vic Secret, Bru1 and Cryo Pop hops to create a flavour explosion
Mosaic, Simcoe, El Dorado, and Amarillo dry hop come together to create a juicy, hazy and bright pale ale that's made to be enjoyed in the sun

Brewed in Collaboration with Cloak & Dagger, this is an experiment with hop formats using 4 different versions of Mosaic - Cryo, whole leaf, Spectrum and T90 - to see how intense we can make it. Expect rich tropical fruits, citrus and earthy pine

This Baltic Porter has drawn inspiration from a 93-year-old brewer in the Latgale region of Latvia, courtesy of our friend Tom from Hat Brewery in Latvia. Made up of 8 dark malts and German Noble hops
